description: To carry out tree surgery to cut back to main stem and remove the horizontal side laterals to One Leyland Cypress in GI within TPO 257 (tree in garden of 1 Tanworth Close)
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
The cypress trees form part of a row which runs the length of Tanworth Close. It forms a privacy
barrier between the properties in Tanworth Close and those in Thirlmere Gardens. A a row they
have a high collective amenity value.
The application wishes to cut back to main stem and remove the horizontal side laterals
overhanging from 1 Tanworth close into number 2 leaving just the upright stems to allow more light
It is unclear as to exactly how much of the cypress this proposal will remove with the potential to
sheer side the tree. The applicant wishes to complete this work to allow more light into the
garden however as the trees are situated to the north of the properties and the other cypresses
appear to have no work proposed (although removal of deadwood is exempt) the work is likely to be
unsightly and not have the desires outcome.
